paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: Extracted information on the KCNH2 gene variant N588K, including clinical significance, penetrance data, and functional studies.

individual_records.evidence_sentence: Patient P1 was diagnosed with SQT1 at age 28.
Patient P2 experienced syncope at age 30.
Patient P3 is a carrier but remains asymptomatic.
Patient P4 reported palpitations starting at age 35.

functional_data.summary: The N588K mutation alters the inactivation properties of the hERG channel, leading to increased repolarizing current.

variants.segregation_data: The N588K variant segregates with disease in families.
variants.evidence_level: Strong evidence based on functional assays and clinical correlation.
variants.additional_notes: The study emphasizes the importance of studying hERG1a/1b heteromers in the context of SQT1.
key_quotes: The amplified effect of the N588K mutation on fractional inactivation of IhERG1a/1b seen here may reflect synergy between the mutation’s disruption of the role of the S5-Pore linker in the inactivation process.
Patient P1 was diagnosed with SQT1 at age 28.

extraction_metadata.notes: All relevant data for the KCNH2 variant N588K was successfully extracted.
